TopicTitle: To speak in a fashion similar to an upper-class person of british origin

Articles.Content:
Oh, jolly. You remind me of me when I was younger! Spiffing!

Well, tally-ho! Off to eat my crumpets!

Cry Havoc! And let slip the dogs of war!

... old chap ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Well, quite a resounding quote of Shakespeare, my good man. However, how does one 'cry havoc?'

> 
> Well, quite a resounding quote of Shakespeare, my good man. However, how does one 'cry havoc?'

Even this expression of emotion confounds me, as said, how does one 'cry havoc?', good man?
One does not cry havoc, but rather, show it vividly.
One simply shouts at an appreciable volume the word 'Havoc!' with appropriate emotion and determination, and then, my dear fellow, let slip the dogs of war!

I say, I say, I say, old chaps and chappetes!

I must ask you hw am i desending ito low gramer liken this.lso/?

I say, that was unexpected!
Sir, u spreak as a lower-class, brutal, barbarian American.
*Colonial*. His speech is in a colonial manner.
![czhBz.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/czhBz.jpg)
Could I have permission to alter my mode of speech into a semi-Old English, my dear sir?

> 
> Could I have permission to alter my mode of speech into a semi-Old English, my dear sir?

Sure! I think I might do that myself;

> 
> Sure! I think I might do that myself;
> 
> Wella, wisan men, wel; gaÃ° ealle on Ã¾one weg Ã°e eow lÃ¦raÃ° Ã¾a foremÃ¦ran bisna Ã¾ara godena gumena Ã¾ara weorÃ°geornena wera Ã¾e Ã¦r eow wÃ¦ron. Eala, eargan idelgeornan; hwy ge swa unnytte sien swa aswundne?

I have no idea what you just said.
That\'s Old English. The premable from *Beowulf*.

Well, this a Bally annoying topic, I say, one would have a heart attack if he saw this.

(I do have an advantage because I am British)
I do believe that \'Middle English\' is the more precise description of that which vexx is interested in.

> 
> I do believe that \'Middle English\' is the more precise description of that which vexx is interested in.

That\'s still like this;

> 
> Whan that Aprill, with his shoures soote
> The droghte of March hath perced to the roote
> 
> And bathed every veyne in swich licour,
> 
> Of which vertu engendred is the flour;
> 
> Whan Zephirus eek with his sweete breeth
> 
> Inspired hath in every holt and heeth
> 
> The tendre croppes, and the yonge sonne
> 
> Hath in the Ram his halfe cours yronne,
> 
> And smale foweles maken melodye,
> 
> That slepen al the nyght with open ye

> 
> (I do have an advantage because I am British)

(You do realise that Americans have the advantage because most of them only think they know what British people speak like through British characters in movies speaking *only* with received pronunciation or cockney dialect?)

> 
> (You do realise that Americans have the advantage because most of them only think they know what British people speak like through British characters in movies speaking *only* with received pronunciation or cockney dialect?)

(Does that mean we make better yanks? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif))

> 
> (Does that mean we make better yanks? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif))

(Certainly.)
Those bloody Yanks and their lies about \'ow Tomas Jefferson was th\' founder of E-lectricity, ev\'ry one knows it was Ol\' Nickola!

Wasn\'t there a thread already about what Americans claim to have invented and who *actually* invented it?

In which case - [/conversation]
Just makin\' some friendly banter here mate.

> 
> Just makin\' some friendly banter here mate.

I know, but the mods don\'t like conversations spreading outside of designated threads. Take MLP as an example.

> 
> Those bloody Yanks and their lies about \'ow Tomas Jefferson was th\' founder of E-lectricity, ev\'ry one knows it was Ol\' Nickola!

Good sir, I do believe you mean Thomas Edison, and not Tomas Jefferson. Jefferson is, in actuality, the 3rd President of the United States. He died over 80 years before the alleged invention of the *lightbulb.* Forgive me, my good man, but one cannot actually invent electricity, not without being God at the very least. Now, lets go out for tea and crumpets shall we? Oh, and please do recall that we need scones for our outing in the woods.
